page.title: 03Macclesfield Forest Industry
page.content:
INDUSTRY
Farming is the predominant industry (see Farming). Forestry and water supply account for 10%.
{Forestry}- Macclesfield Forest, originally the site of 17 farms, was planted to protect the reservoirs from water contamination. Trees are fast growing softwoods (Japanese Larch, Sitka Spruce, Lodgepole Pine) and hardwoods (Sycamore, Oak and Beech). The timber is used for woven fencing, rustic work, pit props, Christmas trees, pulp and blast furnacing. Some timber is sold standing at public auction.
